channel.title: MorningBrew as a feed
channel.description: This is a feed of recent MorningBrew articles published by Huginn

item.title: Gambling Revenue Soars in Q1 to Hit Record
item.description: Las Vegas is back, if you trust all the lines out the door at McCarran International Airport. US commercial casinos raked in $11.1 billion last quarter, according to the American Gaming Association, matching their best quarter ever.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Key Performance Indicators: May 12
item.description: (Eater)  Read: Your last favorite gross viral food videos are all connected to one guy. FWIW, fellow mayoral candidate Shaun Donovan, who was the former Secretary of Housing and Urban Development, guessed $100,000.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: NBC Says it Won't Air Golden Globes in 2022
item.description: The context: The HFPA, an 87-member organization that votes on TV and movie awards, was the focus of a February report in the LA Times that found the group had zero Black members and was doing sketchy things, like flying to lavish parties for Emily in Paris—a series that received two Golden Globe nominations despite low critical approval.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Key Performance Indicators: May 11
item.description: (New Yorker)  Read: A juicy profile of Robinhood and its promise to democratize investing.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Attorneys General Ask Facebook to Drop Plans for Instagram for Kids
item.description: Yesterday, a group of 44 attorneys general asked Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg to ditch plans to develop an Instagram platform for children younger than 13, the current age cutoff for FB services. Bottom line: Just because you can make a product for kids doesn't mean you should."
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: DarkSide, the Group Behind the Colonial Pipeline Hack, Speaks Out
item.description: Can't fix a pipeline problem overnightYesterday, the pipeline's operator, Colonial, said it's hoping to bring the full system back online by the end of the week. But if the shutdown takes longer than expected to resolve, GasBuddy analysts predict gas prices could rise more than a few cents. so far.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Restaurants Struggling to Hire Staff as Lockdowns Lift
item.description: Restaurants have elevated sanitation requirements, plenty of food supply chain issues, and an average annual salary of only $21,470 to serve brunch crowds that have been locked inside for a year. demand for eating out will only increase over the summer, so restaurant chains are raising pay and finding other creative methods to recruit workers. It appears that the restaurant industry in particular just isn't all that attractive for people looking for work.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: From Cheese to Ubers, Prices Are Rising
item.description: Commodities: Prices of copper, steel, and Catan fan-favorite resource lumber have all soared to record highs, causing a corresponding price increase in end products, like houses. Rideshare: If you thought an Uber/Lyft to Malibu was expensive before the pandemic...
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: NBC Says it Won't Air Golden Globes in 2022
item.description: The context: The HFPA, an 87-member organization that votes on TV and movie awards, was the focus of a February report in the LA Times that found the group had zero Black members and was doing sketchy things, like flying to lavish parties for Emily in Paris—a series that received two Golden Globe nominations despite low critic approval across the board.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Restaurants Struggling to Hire Staff as Lockdowns Lift
item.description: Restaurants have elevated sanitation requirements, plenty of food supply chain issues, and an average annual salary of only $21,470 to serve brunch crowds that have been locked inside for a year. demand for eating out will only increase over the summer, so restaurant chains are raising pay and even finding creative methods to recruit workers. It appears that the restaurant industry in particular just isn't all that attractive for people looking for work.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: DarkSide, the Group Behind the Colonial Pipeline Hack, Speaks Out
item.description: But if the shutdown takes longer to resolve, GasBuddy analysts predict gas prices rising more than a few cents. so far.  Crude prices rose about 1% yesterday, so price impacts are still minimal... In the interim, the government relaxed rules so more oil can be driven up the East Coast in tankers.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Attorneys General Ask Facebook to Drop Plans for Instagram for Kids
item.description: Yesterday, a group of 44 attorneys general asked Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg to ditch plans to develop an Instagram platform for children younger than 13, the current age cutoff for FB services. Bottom line: Some concerned adults think that just because you can make a product for kids doesn't mean you should."
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Will Crypto Rule the World?
item.description: The world is truly crypto’s oyster. And while we don’t recommend a doge tat, we do recommend boning up on crypto, even knowing how volatile it is. Not only have cryptos checked that box, they’ve become major players in the $$$ world—aka finance.  And you’ve probably heard a thing or two about NFTs, a blockchain-based way to claim exclusive ownership of a piece of art, video clip, GIF, or even a newspaper column. The promise of DeFi is a financial system that’s more efficient, more tech-driven, and—dare we say it? decentralized finance, or DeFi. Why are those people so hyped? The idea of DeFi is pretty revolutionary.
item.author: Morning Brew

item.title: The Week Ahead: May 10
item.description: Tomorrow is “Eat What You Want Day,” apparently.  Eid al-Fitr begins at sundown on Wednesday, marking the end of the holy month of Ramadan. but will Medina Spirit be there? Everything else:The Preakness is on Saturday...
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Key Performance Indicators: May 10
item.description: (New York Times)  Read: Online cheating charges upend Dartmouth medical school. That is exactly what companies like Facebook were worried about.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: The Kentucky Derby’s Winning Colt Failed Its Drug Test
item.description: The industry will try to address the issue with the Horseracing Integrity and Safety Act, which will go into effect in July of next year. But Baffert seems baffled: “There are problems in racing, but it's not Bob Baffert. I don't believe in conspiracy theories, but why is it happening to me?"
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: From Cheese to Ubers, Prices Are Rising

item.title: Cyberattack Forces Major East Coast Pipeline to Shut Down
item.description: The pipeline is the main source of diesel, gasoline, and jet fuel for the East Coast. Colonial shut down the pipeline Friday as a precaution. Last week, Department of Homeland Security Secretary Alejandro Mayorkas called ransomware one of his “most significant priorities right now,” and the administration has launched an initiative to help critical infrastructure like electric utilities and water districts protect against attacks. cybersecurity poses a major challenge for the Biden administration. Looking ahead...
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Elon Musk Hosts SNL Even Though His Whole Life Feels Like an Episode of SNL
item.description: It’s SNL’s duty to give us interviews with everyone involved in this incident. All played by Melissa Villaseñor. Someone in the audience, Franz, and of course the truck itself. and it shattered. When he had a Tesla designer named Franz throw a metal ball at a Cybertruck window... When he released a song about Harambe.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.description: (Harvard Business Review)  Read: How much energy does bitcoin actually consume?
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: The Odds of Rocket Fragments Falling on You This Weekend are Low...But Not Zero
item.description: ’ You only get to complain if it actually crashes.” There’s only a small chance of it hurting a person, but with some close calls like a huge piece of SpaceX’s Falcon 9 rocket ending up on a Washington farm in April, experts are calling the actions of China’s space program irresponsible.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Vaccine Tracker: May 8
item.description: The latest headlinesGetting the green light: The WHO authorized China’s Sinopharm vaccine for emergency use, the sixth vaccine to have gotten a stamp of approval from the organization.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: April Jobs Report Is a Big Whiff for the US Economy
item.description: Skills mismatch: Perhaps the people looking for jobs don’t have the experience necessary to fill the types of jobs that are open.  Whereas economists had forecasted upwards of 1 million jobs added in April...   Covid reasons: Despite a blazing vaccination rollout in the US, many people might still fear getting infected with the virus at work. After the jobs report was released, the US Chamber of Commerce asked lawmakers to end the extra benefits. economists hope this jobs report was just a bizarre one-off, like Michael Jordan playing baseball.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: The Odds of Rocket Fragments Falling on You This Weekend are Low...But Not Zero
item.description: ’ You only get to complain if it actually crashes.” There’s only a small chance of it hurting a person, but with some close calls like a huge piece of SpaceX’s Falcon 9 rocket ending up on a Washington farm in April, experts are calling the actions of China’s space program irresponsible.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: April Jobs Report Is a Big Whiff for the US Economy
item.description: Skills mismatch: Perhaps the people looking for jobs don’t have the experience necessary to fill the types of jobs that are open.  Whereas economists had forecasted upwards of 1 million jobs added in April...   Covid reasons: Despite a blazing vaccination rollout in the US, many people might still fear getting infected with the virus at work. After the jobs report was released, the US Chamber of Commerce asked lawmakers to end the extra benefits. What we do know is that there is no shortage of jobs in certain industries like retail, manufacturing, and construction.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Meme Battle: Not Your Grandfather's Pie Chart
item.description: We'll pick a new memelord in next week's Sunday Edition and provide you with another meme template to meme-ify.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Icebreakers with...Carlos Watson
item.description: Next weekend, you can catch Watson asking more famous people questions at this year’s virtual OZY Fest, but for now, we ask the questions... You’ve interviewed lots of famous people in your career, what’s your favorite question to ask? And I love to ask people what their karaoke song is. I wish someone would always ask me, “What are your favorite books?” I’m looking forward to the sun, more of it. I love to ask people the most interesting thing they've ever learned about love—it's a really good insight especially from people like Wynton Marsalis and Ava DuVernay. What is a question that you wish people would ask you? I'm looking forward to seeing my buddy José at the YMCA. I'm looking forward to playing pickup basketball.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Meet Jasyn Prolifiq, the Dogecoin Millionaire
item.description: thedogecoinmillionaire. Prolifiq remains bullish about the crypto, but he’s also preparing a content side hustle for life whether dogecoin goes to the moon or burns up before it reaches orbit.  February 7: By 6:59pm ET dogecoin hit $0.08.   Prolifiq first got into investing a few years ago when he bought his first Tesla stock. In February, Elon Musk said that people should not be putting their life savings into cryptocurrency. April 15: Dogecoin hit $0.29 and Prolifiq became a paper millionaire. Prolifiq said he invested ~$180,000 into the meme stock when it was less than $0.05 on February 5, and on April 15, exactly 69 days later—an important number in the doge community because of... “I’m just a dude,” Jasyn Prolifiq said. May 5: Prolifiq’s holdings rose to $2.7 million when dogecoin hit $0.65, up 13,960.31% YTD and close to its all-time high of $0.69, per CoinDesk. He’s already bought the web domain www.  So what about the guy who did?
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Make It Work: When You're Doing Two Jobs at Once
item.description: —Earl  Don't know but shoutout to my mama and 'em.  “I have a very strong urge to quit my job to pursue something I’m actually interested in but am scared to quit. Also, let them know if this kind of work is something you might be interested in continuing. I also hope that you knowing that you’re planning your exit helps with whatever it is you’re feeling about your current role. Ask Kate for advice here.
item.author: Neal Freyman
